definitions: present something formally for acceptance or rejection in a business context
make meat or other food softer by beating or marinating
examples: She decided to tender her resignation next Monday
The company will tender a bid for the construction project
The chef tenders the steak before grilling it
You should tender the meat with a mallet first

definitions: make muscles or body parts tight and rigid through physical contraction
become nervous or anxious causing physical or mental strain
examples: She tensed her muscles before lifting the weight
The athlete tensed his body for the jump
Everyone tensed when they heard the unexpected noise
He tensed up during the difficult interview

definitions: set up camp and sleep in a tent outdoors
create a temporary covering structure over something for protection
examples: We decided to tent in the mountains this weekend
The scouts will tent near the lake tonight
The surgeons tented the wound with sterile gauze
They tented the area to protect it from rain

definitions: grant permanent status to an academic or professional position
hold or maintain a position or status for a period of time
examples: The university will tenure three professors this year
She was tenured after six years of teaching
He tenured as department head for fifteen years
She tenured the position through three administrations

definitions: give a name or designation to something or someone
establish or designate a specific period of time for something
examples: Scientists termed the new species after its discoverer
They termed the phenomenon a breakthrough discovery
The contract was termed for five years initially
The agreement will be termed until further notice

definitions: bring something to a complete and final end or conclusion
end someone's employment contract or dismiss from a position
destroy or eliminate a target completely in military or technical contexts
examples: The company decided to terminate the project immediately
Please terminate all running processes before shutting down
They had to terminate several employees during restructuring
The manager terminated him for repeated policy violations
The mission was to terminate the threat quickly
The system will terminate any malicious processes automatically

definitions: create flat levels on sloping land for cultivation or construction
construct a raised flat platform or paved area adjoining a building
examples: Farmers terraced the hillside to grow rice effectively
They terraced the steep slope for better water retention
We plan to terrace the garden area next spring
The architect terraced the outdoor space beautifully

definitions: create intense fear in someone through threats or violence
control or dominate a person or group through systematic intimidation
examples: The gang terrorized the neighborhood for several months
Wild animals sometimes terrorize rural communities at night
The bully terrorized younger students throughout the school year
The dictator terrorized the population into complete submission

definitions: examine someone's knowledge or abilities through questions or tasks
check how well something works or its quality through examination
try someone's patience or endurance through difficult situations
examples: The teacher will test students on grammar next week
They tested candidates with challenging technical questions
Engineers test the equipment before shipping it out
We need to test this software for bugs
These long delays really test my patience sometimes
The harsh conditions tested their determination to succeed

definitions: give evidence as a witness in a court of law
make a solemn declaration about one's beliefs or experiences
examples: She will testify against the defendant next Tuesday
The witness testified about what he saw that night
Many people testified to his good character and integrity
She testified about her religious conversion at church

definitions: tie an animal or object with a rope or chain to restrict movement
connect a mobile device to another for internet access sharing
examples: They tethered the horse to the fence post securely
You should tether the boat before the storm arrives
Can you tether your phone to my laptop please
She tethered her tablet to access the internet

definitions: send a written message electronically using a mobile phone or device
examples: She texts her friends throughout the day constantly
Can you text me the address when you arrive
He texted the details of the meeting yesterday
They text each other every morning without fail

definitions: express gratitude or appreciation to someone for something they did
examples: She thanked him for helping with the project
I want to thank everyone who attended today
They thanked their supporters with a special reception
Please thank your mother for the wonderful dinner

definitions: cover a roof with straw or similar material in overlapping layers
examples: They decided to thatch the cottage roof traditionally
Local craftsmen still thatch houses in this village
The workers will thatch the barn next month
He learned to thatch from his grandfather's teachings

definitions: cause ice or frozen material to become liquid through warming
become less frozen or cold as temperature rises naturally
make relations between people or countries less hostile and warmer
examples: Remember to thaw the chicken before cooking tonight
The sun will thaw the frozen pipes eventually
The lake begins to thaw in early spring
My fingers slowly thawed after coming inside
Recent talks helped thaw relations between the countries
Their friendship began to thaw after the apology

definitions: organize or decorate something according to a particular theme or concept
examples: They themed the party around tropical island paradise
The restaurant themes each room differently
We themed our wedding with vintage romantic elements
The designer themed the event perfectly

definitions: form a theory or theories about something through reasoning
engage in scientific speculation based on available evidence and logic
examples: Scientists theorize about the origin of the universe
Researchers theorized that the disease spreads through water
Philosophers have theorized about consciousness for centuries
She theorized a new approach to quantum mechanics

definitions: control or regulate temperature using a thermostat device
examples: Please thermostat the room to seventy degrees
They thermostatted the greenhouse for optimal growing conditions
The system thermostats automatically based on occupancy
You can thermostat each zone independently

definitions: make a liquid or substance denser by adding ingredients or reducing
become more dense or viscous through natural processes or time
examples: Add flour to thicken the sauce while stirring
The chef thickened the soup with heavy cream
The fog will thicken as evening approaches tonight
His accent thickened when he became emotional

definitions: make something less thick by removing material or stretching
reduce the density of plants or crowds by removing some
become less dense or crowded over time naturally
examples: You need to thin the paint before applying
She thinned the dough by rolling it out
Gardeners thin seedlings to help plants grow better
We should thin the forest to prevent fires
The crowd began to thin after midnight
His hair has thinned considerably over the years

definitions: use one's mind to form ideas or make decisions rationally
have a particular opinion or belief about something or someone
consider the possibility of doing something in the future
examples: She needs time to think before deciding
Think carefully about all the possible consequences first
I think this plan will work perfectly
Many people think he's the best candidate
We're thinking about moving to another city
She's thinking of changing her career path

definitions: feel a strong need or desire for water or liquid
have an intense desire or craving for something abstract
examples: The runners thirsted for water after the marathon
Animals thirst more during the hot summer months
She thirsted for knowledge throughout her entire life
The nation thirsted for justice and real change

definitions: beat or strike someone or something repeatedly and violently
move in a violent and uncontrolled way often in water
defeat someone completely in a game or competition
examples: The storm thrashed the coastal towns all night
He thrashed the attacker with his walking stick
The fish thrashed wildly trying to escape
She thrashed around in bed during the nightmare
Our team thrashed the opponents five to zero
The champion thrashed all challengers easily

definitions: pass thread or string through the eye of a needle or hole
move carefully through a complex or crowded space
examples: She threaded the needle on her first attempt
Can you thread this ribbon through the loops
He threaded his way through the crowded market
The car threaded between the traffic cones expertly

definitions: express an intention to inflict harm or punishment on someone
pose a danger or risk to something or someone
examples: He threatened to call the police immediately
The gang threatened local business owners for money
Dark clouds threaten rain for the outdoor wedding
Rising waters threaten several coastal communities

definitions: cause someone to feel sudden intense excitement or pleasure
experience a sudden feeling of excitement or exhilaration
examples: The acrobatic performance thrilled the entire audience
Adventure movies always thrill young viewers
She thrilled at the thought of traveling abroad
Audiences thrilled to the musician's virtuoso performance

definitions: prosper and develop well in favorable conditions or environment
grow or develop vigorously showing health and strength
examples: Small businesses thrive in this supportive community
She thrives under pressure and challenging situations
These plants thrive in humid tropical climates
Children thrive when given love and attention

definitions: place someone on a throne as ruler or in a position of power
examples: They throned the new king in an elaborate ceremony
The prince will be throned after his coronation
History throned many unworthy rulers through conquest
The people throned their chosen leader

definitions: gather together in large numbers forming a dense crowd
fill a place with large numbers of people
examples: Fans thronged outside the stadium before the game
People thronged to see the famous celebrity
Tourists throng the beaches every summer season
Shoppers thronged the mall during the sales

definitions: choke or strangle someone by squeezing their throat
control the speed of an engine or vehicle using a throttle
restrict or limit the flow or amount of something
examples: The attacker tried to throttle his victim
Anger made him want to throttle the thief
He throttled back the engine to reduce speed
Throttle the motorcycle carefully around the curve
Internet providers often throttle bandwidth during peak hours
The company throttled production to match demand

definitions: propel something through the air using force from your arm
organize or host a party or event for people
confuse or surprise someone with unexpected information or action
examples: She can throw a baseball incredibly fast
Don't throw stones near the windows please
Let's throw a surprise party for her birthday
They threw a huge celebration after winning
That question really threw me during the interview
His sudden resignation threw everyone off balance

definitions: push something or someone suddenly and forcefully in a direction
impose or force something upon someone without warning
examples: He thrust the sword forward with great force
She thrust her hands into her pockets
Fame was suddenly thrust upon the young athlete
They thrust new responsibilities on the inexperienced manager

definitions: browse or look through pages or items casually using your thumb
request a ride from passing vehicles by extending your thumb
examples: She thumbed through the magazine while waiting
He thumbed the pages looking for the article
They thumbed rides across the country last summer
Don't thumb for rides on the highway

definitions: hit or strike something heavily producing a dull sound
beat or pound rhythmically with a heavy regular sound
examples: He thumped the table angrily with his fist
The box thumped down the stairs noisily
Her heart thumped loudly during the scary movie
Music thumped from the nightclub next door

definitions: produce a loud rumbling sound like thunder
speak in a very loud and forceful manner
examples: The waterfall thunders constantly in the canyon
Hooves thundered across the wooden bridge
The coach thundered instructions at the players
He thundered his disapproval of the decision

definitions: prevent someone from accomplishing something by opposing or blocking their efforts
examples: Security measures thwarted the attempted robbery last night
Bad weather thwarted their plans for a picnic
She constantly thwarts his efforts to improve
Regulations thwart innovation in this industry

definitions: make a regular short sharp sound like a clock
mark an item with a checkmark to indicate selection or completion
examples: The old clock ticks loudly every second
The timer ticked down to zero
Please tick the boxes that apply to you
She ticked off items on her grocery list

definitions: issue a penalty notice or fine for a traffic violation
provide or sell tickets for admission to an event
examples: The officer ticketed him for illegal parking
They ticket speeders regularly on this highway
We need to ticket all guests before entry
The venue tickets events through their website

definitions: touch someone lightly to cause laughter or twitching sensation
amuse or please someone greatly with humor or delight
examples: She tickled the baby's feet making him giggle
The feather tickled his nose causing a sneeze
Your funny story really tickled the audience
The comedian's jokes tickled everyone at the party

definitions: carry or move something using the force of ocean tides
help someone manage temporarily through a difficult period
examples: The current will tide the boat to shore
Waves tided debris onto the beach overnight
This loan will tide us over until payday
The savings tided them through the recession

definitions: make a place neat and organized by arranging things properly
examples: Please tidy your room before guests arrive tonight
She tidies the office every evening before leaving
Let me tidy up the kitchen after dinner
They tidied away the toys after playing

definitions: fasten or bind something with string rope or similar material
achieve the same score or position as another competitor
restrict someone's freedom or ability to act independently
examples: She tied her shoelaces before starting to run
Can you tie this package with string please
Both teams tied at three goals each
The candidates tied for first place
Family obligations tie him to this town
Don't let fear tie you down

definitions: make something tighter by turning twisting or pulling
make rules or controls more strict or severe
examples: Please tighten the screws on the chair
He tightened his grip on the steering wheel
The government tightened security after the incident
Banks have tightened lending requirements recently

definitions: cover a surface with tiles arranging them in a pattern
examples: They plan to tile the bathroom floor tomorrow
The contractor tiled the kitchen backsplash beautifully
We hired someone to tile the shower walls
She learned to tile from watching online tutorials

definitions: prepare and cultivate soil by turning it over for planting
examples: Farmers till their fields before planting crops
He tilled the garden bed with a rototiller
They till the land every spring season
You should till compost into the soil

definitions: move or cause something to lean at an angle
compete in jousting or engage in a competition
examples: She tilted her head to listen better
The earthquake tilted the building dangerously
Knights would tilt at tournaments for honor
Politicians tilt at each other during debates

definitions: measure how long something takes using a clock or watch
arrange for something to happen at a particular moment
examples: The coach timed each runner during practice
Can you time how long this takes please
She timed her arrival perfectly for the surprise
We need to time the announcement carefully

definitions: cover metal with a thin layer of tin for protection
preserve food by sealing it in tin containers
examples: They tin steel to prevent it from rusting
The factory tins metal sheets for export
Factories tin vegetables for long term storage
They used to tin fish before refrigeration

definitions: add a slight trace of color to something
affect slightly with a particular quality or emotion
examples: Sunset tinged the clouds with pink and orange
Age had tinged the paper yellow
Sadness tinged her voice when she spoke
His words were tinged with bitter regret

definitions: feel or cause a slight prickling or stinging sensation
examples: My fingers tingled from the cold winter air
Her skin tingled where he touched her
The spicy food made my tongue tingle intensely
Excitement made her whole body tingle
